definition: to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: The admission notice he received from the university rejoiced his mother's heart.
sentences.chinese: 他收到的大学录取通知书使他的母亲心花怒放。

sentences.english: I still feel giddy and excited when he does this.
sentences.chinese: 每次他这样做的时候，我依然心花怒放。

sentences.english: I saw her sitting in her car and I was joyous.
sentences.chinese: 每次看见她坐在车里，我就心花怒放。

sentences.english: When I give my son a cookie, he is happy.
sentences.chinese: 当我给我儿子一个小甜饼时，他心花怒放。

sentences.english: The flower plants suck to spin Is the gall of be elated.
sentences.chinese: 去吮吸那旋花植物令人心花怒放的毒汁。

sentences.english: Those three words threw him into a tumult of joy.
sentences.chinese: 这三个字使他心花怒放。

sentences.english: When I give my son a , he is happy.
sentences.chinese: 当我给我儿子一个小甜饼时，他心花怒放。

sentences.english: She's licking her chops at the thought of spending all that money!
sentences.chinese: 她一想到能花那一大笔钱不觉心花怒放。
那些奉承使她心花怒放。

sentences.english: Queen returned to the palace, elated, thinking to kill these step-children.
sentences.chinese: 王后回到宫中，心花怒放，以为打发了这些继子女。

sentences.english: Cosette was intoxicated, delighted, frightened, in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 珂赛特如痴如醉，心花怒放，惊恐不安，象进了天堂。

sentences.english: Plush toys plus a bouquet of flowers. I am sure your girlfriend will be happy.
sentences.chinese: 毛绒玩具加一束鲜花，保管你女朋友心花怒放。

sentences.english: Those three words can make her heart jump for joy, you know?
sentences.chinese: 简单的三个字就能让她心花怒放？

sentences.english: Everything is so nice, let man heart flower angry open.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是那么美好，让人心花怒放。

sentences.english: But their dance outdid the sparkling waves in glee with such wonderful scenery, and how could I be sad?
sentences.chinese: 有这么美丽的风景相伴，我怎么能不心花怒放？

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
unable to conceal one's happiness, amazement, shock etc/grinning from ear to ear/mouth agape/gobsmacked
